DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term that represents the clinical trial phase associated with the compound testing.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A substance formed by chemical union of two or more elements or ingredients in definite proportion by weight._Clinical trials are broken into three or four phases: Phase I tests a new drug or treatment for safety in a small group; Phase II expands the study to a larger group of people; Phase III expands the study to an even larger group of people to measure whether the treatment actually benefits patients, and whether its benefits exceed its risks; and Phase IV takes place after the drug or treatment has been licensed and marketed.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A substance formed by chemical union of two or more elements or ingredients in definite proportion by weight.

Concepts.definition: A substance formed by chemical union of two or more elements or ingredients in definite proportion by weight.

Property.preferredDefinition: Clinical trials are broken into three or four phases: Phase I tests a new drug or treatment for safety in a small group; Phase II expands the study to a larger group of people; Phase III expands the study to an even larger group of people to measure whether the treatment actually benefits patients, and whether its benefits exceed its risks; and Phase IV takes place after the drug or treatment has been licensed and marketed.

Concepts.definition: Clinical trials are broken into three or four phases: Phase I tests a new drug or treatment for safety in a small group; Phase II expands the study to a larger group of people; Phase III expands the study to an even larger group of people to measure whether the treatment actually benefits patients, and whether its benefits exceed its risks; and Phase IV takes place after the drug or treatment has been licensed and marketed.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: A category of organic or inorganic substances, elements, and isotopes used in research or for the prevention, diagnosis, and/or treatment of disease states. Includes biologically active substances that are either synthetically manufactured or endogenous substances extracted and processed to be reintroduced into an organism. Chemicals and drugs also include hazardous substances, and naturally occurring or synthetically produced substances required to maintain life.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Curated to support CTD2 activity per request by S.Jagu. mc 10/28/15

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
